Constructor Detail

MessageNioHandler

public MessageNioHandler(java.nio.channels.Selector selector,
                         java.nio.channels.SocketChannel sc,
                         java.util.Vector deadKeys,
                         java.util.Vector writePendingKeys,
                         RxQueue rxQueue)
Each socketChannel has a MessageNioHandler whose main job is to read data from the channel and recover serialized objects from it and to write serialized objects onto it. A serialized object can be recovered by many calls from the selector thread and serializing an object onto the socketChannel can occur in many chunks as well if the channel is busy.

newDataToRead

public java.nio.ByteBuffer newDataToRead(java.nio.channels.SelectionKey key)
method called by selector thread when there is data to read on the socketChannel

Parameters:
key - the selctionKey for the given socketChannel
Returns:
the serialized object when it is fully read - null it the read is only partial

public void readyForWriting()

isWritePending

public boolean isWritePending()

sendObject

public int sendObject(byte[] bytesToSend,
                      SendingListener listener)
asynchronous write method: the object is mapped onto a ByteBuffer and returns after the first write operation on the socketChannel. If that first write was enough to send the whole packet then SENDING_DONE is returned otherwise SENDING_PENDING is returned. The registered SendingListener will be called when all the data has gone

Parameters:
bytesToSend - the object to be serialized
listener - the object to call back when the whole object has been successfully sent on the socketChannel
Returns:
sending error code from SENDING_DONE, SENDING_PENDING or SENDING_REFUSED

writeData

public int writeData()
This method writes out whatever data in stored in ByteBufferArray dataToWrite. It can be called many times by the selector thread until the buffer content has been sent on the channel

Returns:
sending error code from SENDING_DONE, SENDING_PENDING or SENDING_REFUSED
